## PathUtils.dirname() method

Returns the directory name (parent directory) of a path.

Behavior: - Applies `normalize` first. - If the path is root "/" or has no parent, returns "/".

Examples: - dirname('/a/b/c') -<!-- -->&gt; '/a/b' - dirname('/a') -<!-- -->&gt; '/' - dirname('/') -<!-- -->&gt; '/'

**Signature:**

```typescript
static dirname(path: string): string;
```

<tbody><tr><td>

</td><td>

</td><td>

Input path.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

Directory path of the input.
